com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.mvc

Class ControllerFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.HttpFilter
      • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.mvc.ControllerFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessTokenFilter, ChangePasswordFilter, ForgotPasswordFilter, LoginFilter, LogoutFilter, RegisterFilter, VerifyFilter

    public class ControllerFilter
extends HttpFilter
    A Servlet Filter that acts as an MVC Controller by delegating to an internal Controller instance. Because it acts as a controller and not a filter, requests will never proceed past this one in the filter chain - it always handles the response directly. This implies that when configured as part of a filter chain, it must always be the last filter in the chain.
    Since:
    1.0.RC4

      • filter

        protected void filter(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                      javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
               throws Exception
        Description copied from class: HttpFilter
        Same contract as for HttpFilter.doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), but guaranteed to be invoked only once per request. Default implementation simply invokes chain.doFilter(request, response).
        Overrides:
        filter in class HttpFilter
        Parameters:
        request - incoming ServletRequest
        response - outgoing ServletResponse
        chain - the FilterChain to execute
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is a problem processing the request
